hl.seg: Obama SPeech is supportive to Pakistan: President Zardari

doc.seg: Pakistani President Asif Ali zardari has apprecaited the presidential talk of Obama, and he said that he will support to the muslim world, and the pakistan will also support them to get the pakistan and America benefited.
in a statement issued on Wednesday, he said that reiteration of high moralities and values from the American president is a hope for a better future for the people of the world.
president Zardari stated that there is no doubt that there is a great pressure on America to join the world community to find ways of peace, prosperity and complacency.

it should be clear that president Obama after taking the oath for his designation said on Tuesday in his opening speech that America wants development in relations with the Islamic world which should be based on mutual benefits and respect for each other.
he told the people of poor countries that America will work with them so that there is social development and reduction poverty.

hl.seg: President Obama nominated a special representative for Pakistan and Afghanistan.

doc.seg: former ambassador for United Nations Richard Holbrooke has been nominated as a special representative for Pakistan and Afghanistan.
Holbrooke played a vital role in peace agreements in Bosnia Herzegovina.
Holbrooke said that he is ready to be an advisor to president Obama on Afghanistan and Pakistan issues.
He clearly said that this is not an easy task.
He said that both countries have entirely different history.
George Mitchell has been selected for Middle East who will try to revive the Arab Israel dialogue.
Mitchell is an Ex-minister and he had played an important role in establishing peace in northern Ireland.
while talking at the state department today, he said that the situation in the Middle East is very vulnerable, complicated and dangerous.
But despite of this America will not step back from the efforts for peace over there.

hl.seg: Afghanistan: Voters' registration in danger.

doc.seg: Election commission of Afghanistan that due to concerns over security, it is delaying voters' registration is some areas in south.
in southern Afghanistan the voters' registration had to be started this week for the upcoming presidential election.
but the commission has told that unless the security situation does not improve, voters in few areas of province Hilmand will not be able to get registered.
in those parts of South, repression has increased from last year, where the rebel talibans have increased attacks on Afghan and international forces.
meanwhile, the Afghan and international forces have said that during the night, between Wednesday and Thursday, they have killed at least 28 militants during fights across Afghanistan.
NATO has said that their army has destroyed 22 fighters during air and land attacks on Eastern province Khost near the border of Pakistan.
Before that, Afghan Ministry of Defense stated that in the same province, Afghan army killed 8 rebels and injured two.
It is not clear whether Afghan officials have mentioned the same incident.

hl.seg: Two missile attacks in Waziristan, at least 18 people killed.

doc.seg: Pakistan authority has said that at least 18 are dead in the 2 ambiguous American missile attacks in the North Waziristan.
According to the officials, American jet fired three missiles near a house in the area Mir Ali of north Waziristan, killing 10 people in that house.
according to the local officials, there were 5 foreign fighters in those who were killed.
This area is considered the center of the Taliban and Alqaida's fighters.
After a few hours of this incident, southern waziristan was also attacked with a missile, in which at least 8 people died.
Apart from disagreement of Pakistani government, after the mid of the last year, there have been almost 30 missile attacks in Pakistan.
The attacks in these days are not after the American president Prak Obama in control.
Bush management has been abstain from accepting or rejecting these attacks.
In tribal areas of Pakistan Wazeerastan, three mezayles were placed by suspected American spy aeroplane ata Friday in which 5 men dead in this report.
The dead persons have not been acquainted yet.
According to primary knowings these mezile attacks were under taken at the house in Meer Ali area.
It should be in mind that that was the first attack after the being Brak Obama the president.

hl.seg: Province Sarhad government rejected the question of ban on girls education.

doc.seg: Province Sarhad rejected the threat by Taliban soldiers in Swat by saying that this announcement is against law and Islam.
The education prime minister of province Sarhad Sardar Hussain Babur said more that the government will not made these efforts possible.
His saying is that the extremists want that the children in our areas left free from education.
In his words: 'Secretly, these people try to demolish schools and give threats to girls'
Talking about the terror and fear, he said govt is fully aware of this and no force can stop the spread of education on the land of Pakhtoons.
One day ago on 15th of Jan., Taliban under the command of Mulana Fazal-ul-allah demanded to close the schools for girls otherwise these would be demolished.
Despite the military operation in Swat, more than 150 educational institutes have been burnt or destroyed by the extremists.
Due to destruction of these educational institutes, thousands of girls and boys have lost the mean to seek knowledge.

hl.seg: Tight security measures on the Republic day of India.

doc.seg: Indians are going to celebrate their 60th Republic day on Monday. Tight security arrangements are made on this occasion. Thousands of soldiers have been deployed in all parts of the Country.
On the Republic day of India: a grand parade is held, air fighters and military apparatus is displayed in an exhibition.

According to officials, to strengthen the security arrangements, air guns and 'sharp shooter' have been deployed. Police will monitor the routs used for Parade. American president congratulated India on this occasion
He also send good wishes to Indian PM Man Mohn Singh who had a heart surgery a few days ago.
Remember that in the day gone by, Indian police claimed that they killed two precarious Pakistani combatant in the outskirts of New Delhi after a fight.
According to the local authorities, police exported 47 rifles, grenade and some papers from these two persons, which shows that these two are Pakistani.
Police is also investigating if they were related to that Pakistan's invalidated Party Laskhar-e-Tayyaba, which was involved in the Bombay attacks in November last year.

hl.seg: Tea: An effective treatment of Lung Cancer.

doc.seg: New research shows that drinking three cups of tea day
greatly reduces the risk of the lung cancer in women under the age of 50.
This research from the Moffet Cancer Centre in Florida says that the chances of contracting lung cancer in women under the age of 50
who drink tea three times a day, are reduced by 37%
The research also said that having more than three cups of tea daily in women over the age of 50 has on special benefits.
Experts believe that the reason behind this is that tea has some elements that are effective against the formation of cancer cells in women mainly under the age of 50.
More than 5000 women who had lung cancer were treated in the Moffet Cancer Center, in Tampa, Florida.
They were aged between 29 to 74.
Researchers compared their medical records and lifestyles to women who were free of lung cancer.
Experts also discovered that tea was mainly effective on a certain type of cancer, called lopler, and was reduced by 66 %.
Every 10th patient of lung cancer falls under this type of cancer.
This type of cancer is especially dangerous because it is deeper than most, and is usually only discoverable when it has spread significantly.
Experts say that younger females can greatly reduce the risk of lung cancer by regularly drinking three cups of tea every day.
They say that incorporating tea in the daily life can greatly reduce the risk of any cancer.
In Britain, more than 40,000 women are diagnosed with lung cancer every year.

hl.seg: The Afghan war is the greatest challenge faced by America : Gates.

doc.seg: American defense minister Robert Gates has said that the war in Afghanistan is the biggest military challenge faced by America.
Gates will give a briefing today to the Senate and Parliament over the strategies of the Obama regime on Afghanistan and Iraq wars.

Gates told the Armed Services committee of the Senate that fight is not the only solution to the Afghanistan issue. But he added that in order to secure several areas, sufficient number of troops is not there, and the Talibans take advantage of that to carry out their activities.

hl.seg: Why is there decrease in exercise with increase in age?
New Research.

doc.seg: Exercise is good for health in any age.
This makes your heart stronger, decreases cholesterol levels, helps in reducing weight, helps stop diabetes and decreases the chances of Alzheimer's.
Unfortunately, a lot of people tend to exercise less with age.
Experts say that exercises keeps our mind and body alert, and affects the real age of a person.
According to the American Medical Association, not getting enough exercise can lead to numerous health issues.
Dr. Patricia Paylekka of the Mew Clinic of Minnesota reports that with increase in age, exercise is a major factor in determining proper body functioning.
Dr Patricia teaches Medicine in Mew Clinic.
She has done extensive research on older age and the ability to exercise with increasing age.
A team of doctors used High Frequency rays to determine the functioning of the heart.
In which, the ability of the heart to pump blood, and it's ability to shrink and relax was researched.
Experts have concentrated mainly on the left side of the heart which is mainly responsible for the pumping of blood.
They discovered that with increase in age, the problems in the rate of heart relaxation also increase.
Dr. Patricia says that with increase in age, the problems in the heart relaxation rates increases and thus effects the ability to exercise with growing age.
Dr. Carwin Cain was also part of this research.
He says that it's surprising to see the permanent effects of improper exercise on the heart.
In some instances, blood pressure is a factor in heart anomalies and heart diseases.
If doctors and patients can work together when it comes to heart diseases, then they can enjoy the benefits of exercise even with older age.
There has been a detailed report about this in the American Medical Association Publication.

hl.seg: No chances of an immediate war with Pakistan: Indian Army chief

doc.seg: Indian Army Chief General Deepak Kapoor has said that there are no chances of an immediate war with Pakistan how ever we are always ready to defend our country and sacrifice our lives for it.
He has accused that despite of commitments and international pressure on Pakistan as a result of Mumbai attacks, the infrastructure of terrorism is not only existent but also proactive in Pakistan.
he said this while talking to the correspondents in Srinagar.

The Indian Army Chief was on a one day tour to the valley of Kashmir in order to analyze the overall security situation in New Delhi administered Kashmir and preparation of armed forces on the borders.
He was asked a question, that according to the media reports Pakistan has rejected the evidence provided from India regarding the Mumbai attacks, what were his thoughts about it.
General Kapoor said that the decisions of peace or war matters are taken by the political leadership.
Talking about the presence of the skeleton of terrorism on the land of Pakistan,he said allegedly, that India will fight against such circumstances who are ready to destroy peace and weaken India.
He said that there are around 7 to 800 fighters present on the land of Indian Kashmir from which almost 50% are foreigners.

General Deepak Kapoor said that only with the betterment in the weather, the efforts of encroachment between Pakistan and Kashmir under its government can be increased. Although India has increased security on the boarders.
They have refused to the possibility of reduction in the number of army soldiers in Indian Kashmir by stating that one can not compromise over the country's security.

Most elders of our family belonged to labor class.
And when we in our childhood we used to see our uncles doing strenuous labor it gave birth to this desire in our heart that God protects us from strenuous physical labor.
To seek refuge from it we wrote a letter to the editor of daily Amroz and asked what should we do after matriculation exams that we dont have to go through strenuous physical labor.
Editor in his reply wrote that we should become a doctor or an engineer and should opt for such and such subjects to study.
From the beginning we were inclined toward engineering and also in metric we opted for technical drawing instead of biology.
But at the time of admission in FSC elder brother insisted on doing FSC in Pre Medical and become a doctor.
We hardly studied biology for a month and when we couldnt understand a thing we swapped biology for Mathematics.
It means that the fear of strenuous physical jobs made us to become engineers and now we are well placed among many the youth of our family and for this we are thankful to God
This we remembered when we were trying to lift carpet from our old house with our two young sons.
It was not even 30 minutes for us working that our younger son said Dad it feels like I am not born for this job.
We said if it is true then study hard like us and free yourself from physical labor.
Son started saying that I am studying and will complete my studies but I cant do this work .
Three of us somehow managed to finish the job and got back home.
What it means is that when a man decides the destination no matter what were the motives behind this no one can stop him from getting it.
But if you dont even know what you have to do then God be with you.
